title: sysroot spans are not printed on some targets (affected: Debian, rust-lang's own i586; unaffected: Fedora)

labels.name: A-testsuite
labels.description: Area: The testsuite used to check the correctness of rustc

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
**EDIT**(@eddyb): For a detailed update/explanation, see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/53081#issuecomment-558804239.

<hr/>

I'm trying to track down why we have this diff on all arches, which causes that test to fail:

[Test](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/1.28.0/src/test/ui/impl-trait/impl-generic-mismatch.rs), [test output](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/1.28.0/src/test/ui/impl-trait/impl-generic-mismatch.stderr)

~~~~
29	   |
30	LL |     fn hash(&self, hasher: &mut impl Hasher) {}
31	   |                                 ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected generic parameter, found `impl Trait`
-	   | 
-	  ::: $SRC_DIR/libcore/hash/mod.rs:185:13
-	   |
-	LL |     fn hash<H: Hasher>(&self, state: &mut H);
-	   |             - declaration in trait here
37	
38	error: aborting due to 3 previous errors
39	
~~~~

The test passes [on Fedora](https://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org//packages/rust/1.28.0/1.fc29/data/logs/ppc64le/build.log).

Two main things we're doing differently in Debian is that we're currently using cargo 0.27 to build (rather than cargo 0.28) and we also [omit some components](https://salsa.debian.org/rust-team/rust/blob/debian/experimental/debian/patches/d-ignore-removed-submodules.patch). However I don't see why either of these should affect the above test output. I also can't see why [our other patches](https://salsa.debian.org/rust-team/rust/tree/debian/experimental/debian/patches) should affect it.
